post_text: Good morning Bobcats! There is a delay on shipping computers due to COVID-19, but they are expected to arrive by September 16, 2020. We will call parents once they arrived. We apologize for the inconvenience. BHCSA families who have not yet received a laptop computer please come pick up an at-home work packet from your students' teacher today 12PM-4PM.
text: Good morning Bobcats! There is a delay on shipping computers due to COVID-19, but they are expected to arrive by September 16, 2020. We will call parents once they arrived. We apologize for the inconvenience. BHCSA families who have not yet received a laptop computer please come pick up an at-home work packet from your students' teacher today 12PM-4PM.

‚≠êÔ∏èBack to School Tips!‚≠êÔ∏è

School starts in 4 days! Being virtual students it's still important to help your child get into a routine each morning. This can include getting enough sleep, drinking lots of water, and finding the perfect spot to do school work each day.

post_text:
We‚Äôd like to thank our Bobcat families for showing up today for drive-through orientation and on-site enrollment event! We gave out more than 200 computers and connected with nearly 400 families. Our first semester of virtual learning will be a huge success with the help of our amazing parents!

We are still accepting Preschool and Kindergarten applications. If you missed today‚Äôs orientation, attend our final orientation this Friday, August 28, 2020 at 9am-4pm to complete your registeration for the new school year. Go Bobcats!!üíôüíõ

post_text:
Get to know Ms. Dudley and her favorite memories from the 2019-2020 school year!

"I have lots of great memories from the 2019-2020 year. We had a great class that was really kind to each other. I really enjoyed our circle time. We talked about serious topics but had many laughs. The kids made my birthday special by making me special surprises."

post_text:
Get to know Ms. Dudley, our fifth-grade teacher!

"This summer I have been doing a lot of reading and doing crafts. I have a machine called a Cricut where I can cut out vinyl sayings and pictures. I can make t-shirts, make cool prints for picture frames, etc. Taking a little trip somewhere up North would be fun, and I'm hoping we will get to do that before the school year starts again!!"
text:
Get to know Ms. Dudley, our fifth-grade teacher!

I can make t-shirts, make cool prints for picture frames, etc. Taking a little trip somewhere up North would be fun, and I'm hoping we will get to do that before the school year starts again!!"

post_text:
Welcome to Ellis Island! More than 12 million immigrants made their first stop in America at the Ellis Island Immigration Station between 1892 and 1954. In fact, more than 40 percent of Americans can trace their family history back to Ellis Island. Click the image below to take a tour!

http://teacher.scholastic.com/activities/immigration/tour/index.htm
shared_text:
Ellis Island Interactive Tour With Facts, Pictures, Video | Scholastic.com
Learn about immigration on Ellis Island in this interactive, virtual tour. Facts about immigration, pictures of Ellis Island, oral histories, and videos help explain the immigration process to kids.

post_text:
üíôüíõWe are actively enrolling for the upcoming school year and are excited to welcome our newest Bobcats!üíôüíõ

As we adapt to a new way of teaching and learning, Benton Harbor Charter School Academy remains dedicated to our students and parents. Despite the uncertainties that surround the new format of school and work, we are always working in the best interest of our families and will continue to provide quality care and education to our students.

Become a Bobcat today by enrolling at the link below. Please email a copy of your student(s) birth certificate, shot record, well child visit, and parent ID to complete your student‚Äôs application to: sharnaehudson@bentonharborcharter.com

https://bentonharborcharter.com/enroll/

post_text:
Are you looking for a great FREE preschool program? If your child will be 4 years of age on or before September 1, 2020 consider enrolling them in our GSRP program!

For more information and to get an application, please contact our Preschool Director, Rebka Hays at rebekahays@choiceschools.com or call Benton Harbor Charter School Academy at 269-925-3807 and follow the prompts to leave a message.

Our director will contact you within 48 hours. Spots are filling up fast, so don't miss the chance for your child to be enrolled in our high-quality, state-licensed Pre-K program!

post_text:
Looking for a fun activity to work on with your student? The Character Choices Contest is still going on and the closing date has been extended to April 17th! Students can submit a writing piece, a poem, artwork or, a video sharing how compassion has impacted their lives for a chance to win the grand prize!

To learn more and submit your student's work visit: https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSc9XpyTFbdwlzkS09dQmQg18IeKh6aFoUy_swnam81gbXt2iQ/viewform

Winning prizes:
PreK Classroom Winners: drawstring bags, framed certificate
K-3 Student Winners: drawstring bag, certificate, chance to win Family Grand Prize valued at $250 (Family day to a museum or zoo)
4-8 Student Winners: drawstring bag, certificate, chance to win Family Grand Prize valued at $250 (Family day to a museum or zoo)

post_text:
As we‚Äôve said goodbye to February and enter the new month of March, today we‚Äôre highlighting some of our favorite moments from February, and a super successful Black History Month.

Our middle school students were spreading the love for each other and science all month long as they celebrate in their tie dye shirts made in Ms. Newbern‚Äôs science class!
text:
As we‚Äôve said goodbye to February and enter the new month of March, today we‚Äôre highlighting some of our favorite moments from February, and a super successful Black History Month.

Our middle school students were spreading the love for each other and science all month long as they celebrate in their tie dye shirts made in Ms. Newbern‚Äôs science class!

post_text:
In celebration of Black History Month, we asked some of our students to share their favorite historians.

Meet Daysha Jackson, one of our 8th-grade students! Her favorite historian is Rosa Parks.

"Rosa Parks inspires me to stand up for what is right. I'm going to impact the world by helping others and always being authentic in everything I do."

post_text:
In celebration of Black History Month, we asked some of our students to share their favorite historians.

Meet Jayden Robinson, one of our 6th-grade students! His favorite historian is Dr. Marin Luther King Jr., because of his ambition and effort to end segregation.

Jayden said he would like to use the same ambition Dr. King had to chase after his own dreams.

post_text: ‚ÄºÔ∏èGreat news‚ÄºÔ∏è Please help us thank our local representatives by sending them an email.
shared_text:
CHARTERSCHOOLS.ORG
Whitmer signs bill restoring charter school funding increase

Michigan's Charter Schools is feeling amazing.
December 20, 2019 at 3:53 PM ¬∑

‚ÄºÔ∏è BREAKING: Governor Gretchen Whitmer signs SB154 restoring $35 million for charter school students that she had eliminated by a line-item veto back on Oct. 1.

WE SPOKE, THEY LISTENED. üëèüèº

Thank you to every single person who helped us stand up for our students, our educators and our schools! Help us thank the lawmakers who helped restore our funding: bit.ly/micharters-thank-lawmakers
